meta_description: 33 acres of historic houses, gardens, & award-winning exhibitions.
hours_text:
## Visit Goizueta Children’s Experience 

[Tickets](https://my.atlantahistorycenter.com/events?k=ahc%20admission&_gl=1%2a15c5hmm%2a_gcl_au%2aMTA4NjI0MDQwNC4xNzM5OTE2MDY1%2a_ga%2aNzE1MTk2NTUzLjE3Mzk5MTYwNjU.%2a_ga_5E41K5JSS9%2aMTc0MTk2MjQyMy44My4xLjE3NDE5NjI0NDUuMzguMC43NzMyNjg3ODM.)

**This experience is[included](https://www.atlantahistorycenter.com/visit/) with museum admission.** Plan your day with ease and reserve a**timed spot** into the Children’s Experience to guarantee entry. 

The Goizueta Children’s Experience is an exciting new, 5,000 square-foot space at Atlanta History Center Buckhead where kids can experience the city through play, exploration and storytelling. The immersive and multi-sensory design will delight children from crawlers (ages 1-3 years old) to second graders (ages 6-8 years old). 

Each year, Goizueta Children’s Experience introduces a new theme with exciting new experiences. This year, kids can explore the vibrant “**Our Great Big City** ” theme, rooted in Atlanta’s history, innovative spirit, distinctive geography, and dynamic arts and culture scene. Be sure to visit often for more adventures!

**The Goizueta Children’s Experience is located inside the Atlanta History Center’s Buckhead campus.**

[January Daily Programming Calendar](https://www.atlantahistorycenter.com/app/uploads/2025/12/GCE-Event-Calendar-January-2026.pdf)

##  ****

## **Our Guiding Pillars**

Atlanta Geography — Arts + Culture — Innovation + STEM — People

collections_text:
##  ****

Experience Atlanta’s vibrant history with the whole family at the Atlanta History Center, where 33 acres of historic houses, gardens, and award-winning exhibitions await!

##  ****

##  **Now On Display**

[ ](https://www.atlantahistorycenter.com/our-war-too-women-in-service/)

Our War Too: Women in Service 

This is a groundbreaking special exhibit, made up of unique and colorful artifacts from The National WWII Museum’s collection, honoring the nearly 350,000 American women who answered the call to serve their country during World War II.

[Learn More](https://www.atlantahistorycenter.com/our-war-too-women-in-service/)

##  **Can't Miss**

  * Exhibition

[They Were No. 1: The Ichiban Records Story](https://www.atlantahistorycenter.com/exhibitions/they-were-no-1-the-ichiban-records-story/)

Founded in 1985, Atlanta-based Ichiban Records played a pivotal role in shaping Southern hip-hop, nurturing iconic artists, and fostering a distinctive sound. The label, led by visionary John Abbey, was a crucible for talent like MC Shy-D and Kilo. Despite challenges, including a risky partnership with EMI and internal issues, Ichiban’s impact on the music industry, especially in nurturing local talent and promoting diversity, is undeniable. The story is a compelling narrative of ambition, innovation and the complexities of the music business.

  * Story

[Reel vs. Real: WWII Georgia on the Big Screen](https://www.atlantahistorycenter.com/blog/reel-vs-real-world-war-ii-georgia-...
